Event.name: Redirecting
Event.definition:
<def-root>An intentional <fen>Agent</fen> or a causing event (<fen>Cause</fen>) event causes a <fen>Theme</fen> which is already in motion to take a different <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Direction</fen>, or reach a different <fen>Goal</fen> than the <fen>Original_path</fen>.
<ex>The hotel business didn't last - especially after <fex name="Cause">the construction of a railroad</fex> <t>diverted</t> <fex name="Theme">travelers</fex> <fex name="Goal">a few miles west to what is now the village of Eagle</fex></ex>
<ex><fex name="Agent">Pakistan government officials</fex> helped and <t>diverted</t> <fex name="Theme">the trucks</fex> <fex name="Goal">to another camp in the no-man's land in Mach</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Time">Prior to the arrival of the president's motorcade</fex>, <fex name="Agent">the police</fex> <t>redirected</t> <fex name="Theme">the protesters</fex> <fex name="Direction">away from the main road</fex>once more.</ex>
</def-root>

Arg.name: Theme
Arg.definition: <def-root>The entity that is in motion, and changes path due to the action of an Agent or due to a Cause. </def-root>

Arg.name: Original_path
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The route that the <fen>Theme</fen> was originally headed for. In cases when the <fen>Theme</fen> is an intentional actor or is controlled by an intentional actor, the <fen>Original_path</fen> correlates with the (former) plan of the actor. In other cases, the <fen>Original_path</fen> corresponds to what would be expected for the path of the <fen>Theme</fen> from general principles or physics. (In some cases, the <fen>Original_path</fen> may indicate the intended destination, and not just the path, of the <fen>Theme</fen>.)
<ex>VTA <t>detoured</t> motorists <fex name="ori">from southbound I-880</fex> onto Airport Boulevard to access Coleman Avenue.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Path
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Path</fen> refers to (a part of) the ground over which the <fen>Theme</fen> ends up travelling after being diverted.
<ex>Traffic was <t>redirected</t> Tuesday <fex name="Path">along Melrose Avenue</fex> to make way for the scoreboard columns, Mellecker said.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Goal
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The location the <fen>Theme</fen> ends up in after being redirected.
<ex>Not knowing any better, he <t>redirected</t> people <fex name="Goal">to the city center</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the redirection of motion occurs.
<ex><fex name="Time">Last Tuesday</fex> they were <t>detouring</t> everybody down onto 5th avenue .</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the redirection which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of the <fen>Agent</fen> that affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>).
<ex>Anything flagged as suspect by this system would be <fex name="Manr">carefully</fex> <t>diverted</t> to another nearby area, remote from public access. and well shielded, for a second screening .</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The state of the Theme or Agent during the redirection.
<ex>The emergency personnel <t>redirected</t> the cars back towards the border, <fex name="Dep">unaware of the recent conflagration</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> is the location at which the redirection occurs.
<ex>They <t>redirected</t> us <fex name="">at the corner of Alstone and Bokchoy Avenue</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Direction
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE is used for expressions that indicate motion along a line from the current deitic center towards a reference point (which may be implicit) that does not necessarily correspond to the <fen>Goal</fen>. Often <fen>Direction</fen> is defined with reference to the canonical orientation of the <fen>Theme</fen>, the orientation imposed by an implicit observer, or the inherent orientation of the scene.
<ex>Flight 93 left Newark, NJ, earlier that day, bound for San Francisco, but it was hijacked by four terrorists who <t>diverted</t> it <fex name="dir">back toward Washington, DC</fex> . </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The state-of-affairs that the Agent intends to bring about by redirecting the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex>She was talking about how the passengers <t>diverted</t> the plane in order <fex name="pur">to protect the nation's capital</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An individual that determines the change in course of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex>When we ended up over in Marrakech, or Dakar, <fex name="age">they</fex> <t>diverted</t> us up to Tobruk.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Cause
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An event that brings about the change in the <fen>Path</fen> of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex>We even got a bonus morning in Tokyo's international airport when <fex name="Cause">a bad storm</fex> <t>diverted</t> us on the way to Asia.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>The method by which the <fen>Agent</fen> redirects the <fen>Theme</fen>. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: detour.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause to take a different route so as to avoid some location

lexUnit.name: divert.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause to change course or take a different route.
